page.title: 02 Houses in Wilby
page.content: The oldest houses are large,usually built of{ stone} and stand in their own grounds.They are mainly situated in the centre of the village along the main road.On the eastern side is a long row of 19th century terraced houses built of{ red brick.} They have no front garden & open directly onto the path. They once housed the families of farm labourers or people who worked in the shoe factories of Wellingborough. Opposite are semi-detached houses and bungalows built in the 1920's & 1930's. They have large front gardens,{windows with bay-fronts} & some have a{ pebble dashed front} which is typical of the period.Close to the roundabout is an estate of post-war council houses which are mainly built of the same{ coloured brick} and are of the same design.
